intro: Opuntia neuquensis, commonly known as the Neuquén prickly pear, is a species of cactus native to Argentina. It is characterized by its flat, spineless pads and vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its pads are edible and have been used traditionally for food and medicinal purposes. Opuntia neuquensis plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
